metadata.description:
A spiritual dance so beautiful and bedazzaling, evoking the deep memories from within. By Keitaro Arima.

The art:
File type - PNG image
File size - 7.4 MB (7,412,243 bytes)
Dimensions - 3652 × 1193 pixels
Image DPI - 72 pixels/inch
Color model - RGB
Copyright: ©Keitaro Arima

The story:
The Tale of the Heike is an epic account compiled prior to 1330 of the struggle between the Taira clan and Minamoto clan for control of Japan at the end of the 12th century in the Genpei War. Heike refers to the Taira, hei being the Sino-Japanese reading of the first Chinese character.

About the Mangaka:
Keitarō Arima (有馬 啓太郎, Arima Keitarō, born on January 13, 1969) is a Japanese manga artist, best known as the creator of Tsukuyomi: Moon Phase. He was a member of the Manga Dōkōkai OB at Kansai University. His pen names include Pitarō Arima (有馬 秘太郎, Arima Pitarō), Haruo Arima (有馬 晴臣, Arima Haruo) and Pīttarō Arima (有馬 ピーッ太郎, Arima Pīttarō).
metadata.name: Giou from Tale of the Heike
